content.description: Climb the face on the far right side starting from the main ledge (choose a starter route to gain this ledge). Stay on the face until it ends at a ledge, step off the ledge to the left and follow the crack system to the top.
content.location: starts at the far right side on the main ledge (gained by a starter route). See beta photo.

content.description:
Choose your start (5.4 starter crack, Cal's Ceiling, or the boulder start) then once at the ledge climb up to and use the splitter crack directly left of Calvins Corner. 

  Follow the splitter to its end at a ledge with a tree (can't miss it) then traverse a short distance to finish on the last few feet of Calvins Corner. 

  Can be done in one or two pitches. No need for two but it'd be fun/good practice. Climb to the big ledge and belay second up or climb until you get to the bottom of the splitter proper and create a gear anchor using Calvins Corner and belay the second up.
content.protection: Standard rack. This route you can sew up.
content.location: Immediately left of Calvins Corner. Its the obvious splitter.

content.description: Climb the long left facing corner that is on the right side of the area. Gain this corner by using one of the starting routes (mix and match if you'd like) and you'll end up at the big ledge. From the ledge head into the corner.
content.protection: Plentiful. Standard up to 3". If you have #4 (BD Camalot) sized pro it'll take it but not needed.

content.description: Climb the offwidth (for the skinny just about a squeeze chimney) and pull the roof. If avoiding offwidths the face also can be climbed then pull the roof and this goes about 5.5/5.6.
content.protection: If you don't have small children sized protection use the face.
content.location: Right facing corner crack on the right side of Calvin's Slabs base.

content.description:
This area has a few really fun routes. 100ft of of solid rock (plenty of gear placement options that are sound) with face climbing, a fun roof, corner routes and a few jams here and there and a really fun offwidth to roof start option called Cal's Ceiling 5.7+. You'll find a nice mix of features in this area. Great cruising to moderate difficulty level routes.  

  Most of the routes start at the big ledge about 20ft up (can't miss it once there). You can mix and match routes (starter route to ledge links to start of another route) easily.  

  There are options for anchors on top including slinging natural features.
